content.description:
Previously “project rejection” in Sierra Allan’s Yukon bouldering guidebook. Sit start. Right hand on the nice side pull, left hand low on the slopey arrete. Big moves and compression.



See project rejection in guidebook.

Pads

Start Left of the arete, left hand on good side pull right on, poor opposing side pull. Some high tension moves up and right until you pull the corner to gain the arete. Float on technical moves to the top.

 



Located in the first section of boulders you come upon. Problem is  on the opposite side to Pura-Vida on the same boulder. 

Pads and spotter.

Stand start: Left hand on small crimp on the face and right hand low on the rail. A hard first, then follow the rail up and left.  Tops in the centre of the boulder. Don’t think it’s over as the mantle just might be the crux.  



Walk about 50m up the hill from Anasazi

Pads and spotter

Previously "Chase The Sun Project" in Sierra Allen's guidebook. 

Stand Start: Left hand on big sloper hold, right hand on side pull. Slap and work your way up until you gain the bad sloper and roll left to top out.  

Sit start is still a project. Topping out on the right of the arrete would make for a harder problem.   



Big Julie Boulder 

Good landing.

Home to the best bouldering in the Yukon. While a bit of a journey to get there it is well worth the 4x4 drive. Boulders range from v0 slab to v9 overhangs and with many hard lines await first ascents.  The style rewards good footwork and those who excel at slopere  

The Allan’s Yukon Bouldering guidebook covers the majority of the boulders, although there has been some development in recent years.
